title: Issue Regarding to instance path in testsuite directory
body:
## Made changes regarding to instance path of files in flask/testsuite/test_apps

While running test case by run-test.py module it causes Error for instance path.

``` sh
FAIL: test_main_module_paths (flask.testsuite.config.InstanceTestCase)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "../flaskenv/flask/flask/testsuite/config.py", line 157, in test_main_module_paths
    self.assert_equal(app.instance_path, os.path.join(here, 'instance'))

  File "../flaskenv/flask/flask/testsuite/__init__.py", line 141, in assert_equal
    return self.assertEqual(x, y)

AssertionError: '../flaskenv/var/run-tests-instance' != '../flaskenv/flask/instance'
- ../flaskenv/var/run-tests-instance
?             ^ ^ ----------
+ ../flaskenv/flask/instance
?             ^^ ^^
```

``` sh
FAIL: test_uninstalled_module_paths (flask.testsuite.config.InstanceTestCase)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "../flaskenv/flask/flask/testsuite/config.py", line 164, in test_uninstalled_module_paths
    self.assert_equal(app.instance_path, os.path.join(here, 'test_apps', 'instance'))

  File "../flaskenv/flask/flask/testsuite/__init__.py", line 141, in assert_equal
    return self.assertEqual(x, y)

AssertionError: '/hom[23 chars]ang-py3-test/flaskenv/var/config_module_app-instance' != '/hom[23 chars]ang-py3-test/flaskenv/flask/flask/testsuite/test_apps/instance'
- ../flaskenv/var/config_module_app-instance
?             ^ ^ ---  ^^^^^^^     ^
+ ../flaskenv/flask/flask/testsuite/test_apps/instance
?             ^^ ^^  +++++++++++ ^ +++++    ^^
```

``` sh
FAIL: test_uninstalled_package_paths (flask.testsuite.config.InstanceTestCase)
\----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "../flaskenv/flask/flask/testsuite/config.py", line 169, in test_uninstalled_package_paths
    self.assert_equal(app.instance_path, os.path.join(here, 'test_apps', 'instance'))

  File "../flaskenv/flask/flask/testsuite/__init__.py", line 141, in assert_equal
    return self.assertEqual(x, y)

AssertionError: '/hom[23 chars]ang-py3-test/flaskenv/var/config_package_app-instance' != '/hom[23 chars]ang-py3-test/flaskenv/flask/flask/testsuite/test_apps/instance'
- ../flaskenv/var/config_package_app-instance
?             ^ ^ ---  ^^^^^^^^     ^
+ ../flaskenv/flask/flask/testsuite/test_apps/instance
?             ^^ ^^  +++++++++++ ^ +++++    ^^

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 226 tests in 4.574s

FAILED (failures=3)
```

Changes In the following files remove this instance path Error from the Test case:
- flask/testsuite/test_apps/config_module_app.py.

``` sh
app = flask.Flask(__name__, instance_path=os.path.join(
               os.path.abspath(os.path.dirname(__file__)),'instance')
              )
```
- flask/testsuite/test_apps/config_package_app/**init**.py.

``` sh
app = flask.Flask(__name__, instance_path=os.path.join(os.path.abspath(
                os.path.dirname(os.path.dirname(__file__))),'instance')
              )
```
- flask/testsuite/test_apps/main_app.py

``` sh
import os

app = flask.Flask('__main__', instance_path=os.path.join(
                os.path.abspath(os.path.dirname('__main__')),'instance')
              )
```

comments_inline.body:
Just as before...

> I don't think it makes any sense to split this into four commits. Also, the commit messages are absolutely meaningless. Can you please squash them into one and use a message that actually explains the change instead of the files you changed?

The line wrapping style is also _very_ weird and I guess not PEP8-valid.

I don't get these errors when running `py.test` or `tox`, [nor does Travis-CI](https://travis-ci.org/mitsuhiko/flask/builds/94776144).

If the instance path is getting set incorrectly, are we sure we just want to be manually setting it in the tests rather than fixing why it's getting set incorrectly?

Error Occure While I execute run-test.py with python interpreter.
And entry in the CHANGES is not mine it may be merged when I squashed my commit and by mistake it is merge to someone else commit
@davidism: The PR is for 0.10 which doesn't use py.test yet

Not saying this isn't happening in some configuration, but I don't get the error with `python run-tests.py` or `tox` on the 0.10-maintenance branch either, [nor does Travis](https://travis-ci.org/mitsuhiko/flask/builds/71225501).  Where/how are you running this to get this error?

I follow below process in virtualenv with python3.4 and flask 0.10.1 installed :

``` sh
$ git clone https://github.com/mitsuhiko/flask.git
```

``` sh
$ cd flask/
$ git checkout 0.10.1
```

``` sh
$ python run-tests.py
```

OK, I can reproduce it, by having the flask source cloned _inside_ the virtualenv folder. I think that's a very obscure idea in the first place...
It is working fine on python 2.7. I am also able to execute it on python2.7 but not on python3.4
Does it fail for you if you are not inside the virtualenv's folder (usually you don't put any custom stuff inside there, but rather have e.g. `flask/.env` as your virtualenv location)

There are a couple of weird things in your setup.  Typically the virtualenv is created inside (or completely separate from) the project folder.  You've installed the release distribution, but then are testing with the repo tag.  Use `pip install -e .` instead to install the code in development mode, or just don't install flask==0.10 from pypi.

If the Flask app sees its files inside a virtualenv, it assumes it is installed for production and the default instance path changes.

``` bash
$ git clone https://github.com/mitsuhiko/flask flask_test
$ cd flask_test
$ virtualenv -p /usr/bin/python3.4 env
$ source ./env/bin/activate
$ pip install -e .
$ python run_tests.py
```

At this point I don't think this is a bug with Flask, it's a problem with your environment.

Anyway, my original point was that if we think that Flask's autodetection for the instance path is incorrect, we need to change that behavior, not just force the path in the tests, which just hides the issue.  I think Flask is doing the right thing though.

First thing virtualenv is named as "flaskenv" not "flask/.env" means env is not create inside the flask  and Yes if I run test cases without using virtualenv it run successfully. And Yeah it may be problem with my environment but I am not fully sure that environment have something wrong. And yes forcing path is not good way but it helps me.

That's the whole problem: You have this structure:

```
.../flaskenv/  # your virtualenv
.../flaskenv/flask/  # your flask git clone
```

Usually you have this:

```
.../flask/  # the flask git clone
.../flask/.env/  # the virtualenv
```
Yeah It's Working when env is created inside the repo
